description: Cloud Service Provider, i.e., the company providing the Cloud Service Offering.
Cloud Service Offering, i.e., the name of the company's cloud product.
The type of cloud service: Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS), Platform as a Service (PaaS), Software as a Service (SaaS) or a combination (i.e., PaaS & SaaS or IaaS & PaaS)..
Unique identifier for CSP product reviewed by FedRAMP.
source: Automatically assigned by the FedRAMP PMO.

description: The type of FedRAMP authorization achieved by this CSO.  Can be JAB, Agency or CSP-Supplied.

If "Y," indicates that this ATO leverages an existing ATO or P-ATO (e.g., the original P-ATO or the first Agency ATO for a CSP).  If "N," then this ATO/P-ATO is the original P-ATO or sponsoring Agency ATO or CSP.
The authorization date is the "Authorization to Operate" (ATO) letter or the date of the P-ATO.
The authorizing date stamped or printed on the ATO/P-ATO Letter
The most recent date of when the authorizing official signed the ATO/P-ATO letter
The designation which identifies CSP is in the FedRAMP Process. Can be "FedRAMP Ready", "In Process", "In PMO Review", or "Compliant"
The type of cloud model -- Private Cloud, Public Cloud, Community Cloud, Hybrid Cloud or a combination.
The security level for the cloud service offering. Can be Low, Moderate or High.
The name of the agency listed on the leveraged ATO letter.
The name of the subagency within the Authorizing Agency listed on the leveraged ATO letter
The date that the ATO letter expires. Typically three years from the Authorization Date unless stated differently on the letter.

The name of the agency that sponsored the CSP-CSO.  For the original, sponsoring CSP-Supplied authorization, the value is "CSP Supplied."  For the original JAB P-ATO letter, the value is "JAB Authorization,"  This is because there is only a sponsoring Agency for a Agency ATO.
The name of the point of contact for the Cloud Service Provider.
The email of the point of contact for the Cloud Service Provider.
The website URL of the Cloud Service Provider.
The name of the point of contact for the Authorizing Agency.
The name of the independent assessor that reviewed the cloud service offering. In most cases, the independent assessor is part of the FedRAMP 3rd Party Assessment Organization program.
Description of the services provided by the CSO.  This is formatted using Markdown.
Date at which a package is recognized as FedRAMP Authorized.
Identifies if this row should be included in the Marketplace.  For example, private clouds (e.g., CRMaaS from DHS) should not be included in the Marketplace.
Contains a URL pointing to graphics file containing the logo for the CSP associated with this authorization.
For Agency packages, this is the date that the Agency is expected to issue an ATO letter for the CSP.  For CSPs pursuing a P-ATO, this is the date of the projected P-ATO.
source:
Agency ATOs: Agency
P-ATOs: FedRAMP PMO

description: Date that a package was determined to be FedRAMP Ready
Date that a package was determined to be FedRAMP In-Process

PackageID of FedRAMP-Authorized packages used by this package.  Some FedRAMP packages use (at a lower layer) other FedRAMP-authorized packages.  For example, Microsoft  Dynamics CRM Online for Government (CRMOL) uses Microsoft Azure and Microsoft Global Foundation Services (GFS) Cloud Infrastructure, both of which are FedRAMP Authorized.
The URL pointing to a graphics file with the assessor's company logo.
The assessor's company name.
Identifies whether or not this assessor is in remediation status with the FedRAMP PMO to address issues,

field: FedRAMP Accreditation Date (by either FedRAMP originally or A2LA)
description: The date that this assessor was certified as a 3PAO.
The founding date of the assessor company.
Email address of the assessor company.  Any questions regarding this assessor should be sent to this email.
URL for the assessor company.
Addresses of up to 3 locations for this assessor.
Description of the services provided by the assessor.  In Markdown format.
List of the CSPs assessed by this 3PAO.
Identifies if the assessor also provides FedRAMP-related consulting services.
Provides detail on the services provided by the assessor.

field: CSPs You've Provided Consulting Services To
description: List of CSPs that an assessor has provided consulting services to.

field: Additional Cyber Frameworks Supported by Assessor
description: List of additional, cybersecurity frameworks supported for which an assessor is accredited (e.g., NIST, ISO frameworks)
